name: Hindu Gods
description: A brief description about Hindu Gods and Goddesses

God.val: Brahma is the first member of the Hindu Trinity and is " the Creator" because he periodically creates everything in the universe
Vishnu is the second member of the Hindu Trinity. He maintains the order and harmony of the universe
Shiva is the third member of the Hindu Trinity, tasked with destroying the universe in order to prepare for its renewal at the end of each cycle of time
Ganapati, also known as Ganesha, is Shiva’s first son
Rama is one of the most beloved Hindu gods and is the hero of the Hindu epic called the Ramayana
If one Hindu god’s name is known and recognized throughout the world, it is Krishna

God (continued).key: Indra, the King of Heaven and lord of the gods
God (continued).val: Indra wields a thunderbolt and is a protector and provider of rain.
Surya (or Soorya) is a golden warrior arriving on a chariot pulled by seven white horses
Agni holds a special place in Hindu fire ritual to this day as the sacrificer

God (continued).key: Hanuman, the monkey king and devoted servant
God (continued).val: Hanuman is featured in the great Hindu epic the Ramayana as a servant of Rama

Goddess.val: Saraswati is the consort of Brahma the Creator and is worshipped as the goddess of learning, wisdom, speech, and music
Lakshmi is the goddess of good fortune, wealth, and well-being
Durga Devi is a powerful, even frightening goddess who fights fiercely in order to restore dharma (moral order)
Parvati is the Hindu goddess of love, fertility and devotion
